cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 980 MI...1580 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP3 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Depression Eight-E Advisory Number 6 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP082017 200 PM PDT Wed Jul 19 2017
...DEPRESSION REMAINS WEAK AND POORLY ORGANIZED...
SUMMARY OF 200 PM PDT...2100 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...14.1N 121.7W ABOUT 980 MI...1580 KM SW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...30 MPH...45 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WSW OR 240 DEGREES AT 6 MPH...9 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1009 MB...29.80 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 PM PDT (2100 UTC), the center of Tropical Depression Eight-E was located near latitude 14.1 North, longitude 121.7 West. The depression is moving toward the west-southwest near 6 mph (9 km/h), and a slow motion toward the southwest or south-southwest is expected during the next couple of days.
Maximum sustained winds have decreased to near 30 mph (45 km/h) with higher gusts. Little change in strength is forecast during the next 48 hours.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1009 mb (29.80 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 PM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Blake
NNNN
